question: I've gotten myself into a big procrastinating habit, how can I get myself out?
question_content:

Somehow I've gotten myself through high school and onto university without much effort (yeah I guess I'm pretty smart), but now I've gotten to the point where I am spending ALL my time on youtube, video games, T.V, wasting time with friends. I am slowly feeling the effects of not studying with my test marks as a reflection. I now also realize I can't get by anymore without doing the proper work, but I just can't seem to get myself out of this hoe I dug myself into. 

I am constantly playing games on steam, or PS3, on a daily basis. I also watch a lot of hockey on T.V. I love these things but I believe it's about time I start prioritizing those behind my school work. 

Often during school nights where I sleep 2-3 hours due to staying up playing games, resulting in energyless for school the following day.
I also feel that once I fall behind in a course load, I would just "give up" and neglect the homework/ studying required even further.

Even now, with having two finals tomorrow which I am not ready for, I am still having problems focusing on studying. 

How can I fix this problem? I feel like I have little motivation to study. Is there a specific attitude I should tackle this problem with?
